title: PC Shipments Rose on Software Upgrades, Looming Tariffs
text:
Personal-computer makers saw strong growth in third-quarter shipments as buyers rushed to upgrade machines to run Microsoft Corp.’s latest Windows software and dodge looming tariffs on imports from China that could drive up prices, according to preliminary data from three research firms.

However, PC makers face an uncertain fourth quarter, the firms said. The upgrade cycle—prompted by new software not designed to run on some older machines—is expected to wane. The fourth quarter includes holiday sales and could see customers...
description: Personal-computer makers saw strong growth in third-quarter shipments as buyers rushed to replace machines too old to run Microsoft Corp.’s latest Windows software and dodge looming tariffs on imports from China, according to preliminary data from three research firms.
